DOC.brief_title: Effect Nutritional Counseling Based Diet Quality Metabolic Control Patients With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus
DOC.detailed_description: Randomized clinical trial outpatient patient type 2 diabetes mellitus treat Endocrinology Division , Hospital de Clinicas de Porto Alegre . The study aim carry nutritional counseling direct offer benefit metabolic control diabetic patient . The initial step perform analysis composition diet quality , anthropometric laboratory evaluation . After initial assessment meeting criterion eligibility , patient randomize receive nutritional counseling diet quality ( intervention group ) usual diet accord current nutritional recommendation ( control group ) . Both group receive adjust caloric intake nutritional need patient . Patients follow six month , monthly basis hospital visit telephone monitoring . The outcome evaluate : achievement therapeutic target ( fast blood glucose level 70-130 mg / dL , HbA1c < 7 % , LDL cholesterol < 100 mg/dL triglyceride < 150 mg/dL ) ; use antidiabetic drug , lipid-lowering antihypertensive drug , adherence necessary dietary change .
DOC.criteria: Type 2 diabetes patient age ≥ 30 year ; Body mass index ≤ 40kg/m² ; Serum creatinine < 2 mg/dL ; Serum triglycerides < 400 mg/dL . Cognitive impairment ( clinical suspicion ) ; Illiterate ; Liver function test abnormal thyroid ; Urinary tract infection carrier , kidney disease heart failure uncompensated ( grade III IV ) ; Active waste disease diagnosis ( Cancer , Acquired Immune Deficiency Syndrome ) ; Metabolic control within therapeutic target ; Patients dietary guidance nutritionist less three month .
